page.title: 11EDUCATION IN THE LYTHE AREA
page.content: {EDUCATION:-} LYTHE has had a village school since the early 19th century.It was an all age Church of England School. With the introduction of the 1947 Education Act,the school became a Voluntary controlled Church of England School.In 1977 the old school was closed and became the Village Hall.The present building had been erected by the N.Y.C.C.. This school wqs opened by the Marquis of Normanby on 20th.May 1977 to about 90 pupils who transferred from the old school with the staff. The school now has 62 pupils between the ages of 5 and 11+ years.At 11+ years the children automatically transfer to Secondary Education at Caedmon School Whitby.(11+ to 14+yrs.) and then to Whitby School(14 to 16yrs.)
